doc.after: There is no written record of who built the Borobudur or of its intended purpose.[21] The construction time has been estimated by comparison between carved reliefs on the temple's hidden foot and the inscriptions commonly used in royal charters during the 8th and 9th centuries. Borobudur was likely founded around 800 CE.[21] This corresponds to the period between 760 and 830Â CE, the peak of the Sailendra dynasty rule upon Mataram kingdom in central Java,[22] when it was under the influence of the Srivijayan Empire. The construction has been estimated to have taken 75 years and been completed during the reign of Samaratungga in 825.[23][24]
